title: Colour Idioms
instructions: Work in pairs using one phone between you. Both of you can see the cards all the time. Take turns to rephrase the sentences using the keyword given. In each turn, give your partner 2 points for a correct answer without using the "Clue" button or 1 point if they need to click on it. The counter buttons are only active when the answer is displayed.

cards.sentence: The job was offered to her quite unexpectedly.
cards.answer: The job was offered to her out of the blue.

cards.sentence: She let him into the office and gave him a few minutes before catching him in the act of photocopying the secret documents.
cards.answer: She let him into the office and gave him one minute before catching him red-handed.

cards.sentence: Frankly, I still can't resist the temptation to have some Nutella very occasionally while making breakfast for the kids.
cards.answer: Frankly, I still can't resist the temptation to have some Nutella once in a blue moon while making breakfast for the kids.

cards.sentence: It always makes me sad when October evenings start drawing in earlier and earlier.
cards.answer: I always get the blues when October evenings start drawing in earlier and earlier.

cards.sentence: All your friends will be jealous when they see these shoes.
cards.answer: All your friends will be green with envy when they see these shoes.

cards.sentence: The economy is soaring, we have even paid off our state debts.
cards.answer: The economy is soaring, even the state budget is back in the black.

cards.sentence: She passed the exam with a very high mark.
cards.answer: She passed the exam with flying colours.

cards.sentence: People who drop litter in the street make me really angry.
cards.answer: People who drop litter in the street make me see red.

cards.sentence: As the lads left the studios they signed autographs for fans - who must've been happy-clappy.
cards.answer: As the lads left the studios they signed autographs for fans - who must've been tickled pink.

cards.sentence: The player was allowed to leave his club under certain conditions, which have been met.
cards.targetLanguage: to give something/someone the green light
cards.answer: His club gave the player the green light to leave under certain conditions, which have been met.

cards.sentence: If you owe money to your bank, you get charged 30p for each transaction.
cards.answer: If you are in the red, you get charged 30p for each transaction.

cards.sentence: She hasn't worked a day in her life. She was born into a rich family.
cards.targetLanguage: to be born with a silver spoon in his/her mouth
cards.answer: She hasn't worked a day in her life. She was born with a silver spoon in her mouth.

cards.sentence: So why are global leaders pretending not to notice basically all the environmental issues?

cards.answer: So why are global leaders turning a blind eye to basically all the environmental issues?

cards.sentence: He was going to marry her but he got too frightened about it on the day of the wedding. They haven't been in touch since.
cards.answer: He was going to marry her but he got cold feet on the day of the wedding. They haven't been in touch since.

cards.sentence: The kids have no reason to change their behavior because you are not firm and clear about what they can do.
cards.answer: The kids have no reason to change their behavior because you just don't put your foot down.

cards.sentence: I was really nervous as I was looking up my exam results on the website.
cards.targetLanguage: my heart was in my mouth
cards.answer: My heart was in my mouth as I was looking up my exam results on the website.

cards.sentence: You need to stay calm if you want to remain in control and win this match.
cards.answer: You need to keep your head if you want to remain in control and win this match.

cards.sentence: Apparently, the two of them have never agreed on anything really.
cards.targetLanguage: to see eye to eye with someone
cards.answer: Apparently, the two of them have never seen eye to eye on anything really.

cards.sentence: No offence, but you really shouldn't try to interfere in things you just don't understand.
cards.targetLanguage: to stick/poke your nose into something
cards.answer: No offence, but you really shouldn't be sticking your nose into things you just don't understand.

cards.sentence: Thank you for keeping this secret and making this party an absolutely perfect surprise.
cards.answer: Thank you for holding your tongues and making this party an absolutely perfect surprise.

cards.sentence: We can't do much but we all hope to see a favourable outcome in the end.
cards.targetLanguage: to keep your fingers crossed for something
cards.answer: We can't do much but we all keep our fingers crossed for a favourable outcome in the end.

cards.sentence: If you could help me here, I would appreciate that very much.
cards.answer: If you could give me a hand here, I would appreciate that very much.
